etymologies: Middle English: via Old French from Latin anisum, from Greek anison ‘anise, dill’

definitions: a Mediterranean plant of the parsley family, cultivated for its aromatic seeds which are used in cooking and herbal medicine.

notes.text: Pimpinella anisum, family Umbelliferae. See also aniseed

definitions: an Asian or American tree or shrub that bears fruit with an odor similar to that of aniseed.

notes.text: Genus Illicium, family Illiciaceae: many species, especially star anise (I. verum), used in Chinese cooking

shortDefinitions: Asian or American tree or shrub which bears fruit with aniseed-like odour
